snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and his police commissioner were in fine fettle after a court ruling on the city’s stop-and-frisk tactic, which is not to be confused with doing themselves any favors.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column holds Mayor Michael R Bloomberg and Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly both display a fossil-like rigidity, refusing to concede even a jot of a point to the federal judge who imposed a monitor on the Police Department, or to the many critics who warned so often that a once-reasonable stop-and-frisk program had metastasized.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and his police commissioner were in fine fettle after a court ruling on the city’s stop-and-frisk tactic, which is not to be confused with doing themselves any favors.

headline.main: Mayor’s Take on Policing Lacks Nuance
headline.print_headline: Mayor’s Take On Policing Lacks Nuance
